polyAdmin

Class Collection

  • java.lang.Object
    • polyAdmin.Collection

  • public class Collection
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0
    This class is the backbone of the program. Polynomials are saved in the ArrayList collection. Operations with this saved polynomials are collected here.
    Note: Polynomial values can only be set by the class Polynomial.
    Author:
    Miles Lorenz (S0556515)
    See Also:
    Polynomial

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Polynomial> collection

      Constructor and Description
      Collection()
      ArrayList collection is initialized

    • Method Detail

      • addPolynom

        public void addPolynom(Polynomial polynomial)
        adds a polynomial at the end of the collection.
        Parameters:
        polynomial - polynomial which is to be added to collection

      • addPolynom

        public void addPolynom(int position,
                       Polynomial polynomial)
        adds a polynomial at a specific position of the collection.
        Parameters:
        position - position where the polynomial is to be added
        polynomial - polynomial which is to be added to collection

      • createPolynom

        public Polynomial createPolynom(double[] poly_array)
        creates polynominal of the class Polynomial from a given double-array
        Parameters:
        poly_array - given double-array containing the factors. The Position in the array gives the value of the power
        Returns:
        a optimized (= no empty fields at the end) polynomial of the class Polynomial

      • deletePolynom

        public void deletePolynom(int position)
        removes a polynomial from the array-list collection
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial that gets deleted

      • getPolynom

        public Polynomial getPolynom(int position)
        returns a polynomial from the array-list collection
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial thats get returned
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText(int position)
        returns a polynomial from the array-list as a displayable String (for more info about the returned String at Polynomial.toString() method
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial
        Returns:
        displayable String

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        returns the number of the saved polynomials in the array-list collection
        Returns:
        int

      • getAsArray

        public Polynomial[] getAsArray()
        returns the array-list collection as an array. The array is generated fresh by call and reference is not stored.
        Returns:
        Polynomial[]

      • valueAt

        public double valueAt(int position,
                      java.lang.String x_value)
        calculates and returns the y-value belonging to a handed over x-value from a polynomial of the array-list collection the used mathematical method is pluging in the x-value in the polynomial
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial in the array-list collection
        x_value - x-value, which is plugged in. Is the x_value not parsable to Double x_value is handled as 0.
        Returns:
        Double y-value

      • valueAt_Horner

        public double valueAt_Horner(int position,
                             java.lang.String a_value)
        calculates and returns the y-value belonging to a handed over x-value from a polynomial of the array-list collection the used mathematical method is the horner-scheme: (polynomial) / (x - a)
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial in the array-list collection
        a_value - a-value of the term (x-a) Is the a_value not parsable to Double the result is given as the y for = 0.
        Returns:
        Double y-value

      • addition

        public Polynomial addition(int position_1,
                           int position_2)
        calculates and returns the sum of two polynomials from the array-list collecion. polynomials can be added with them self
        Parameters:
        position_1 - index in the array-list collection of the first polynomial
        position_2 - index in the array-list collection in the second polynomial
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • subtraction

        public Polynomial subtraction(int position_1,
                              int position_2)
        calculates and returns the difference of two polynomials from the array-list collecion. polynomials can be added with them self
        Parameters:
        position_1 - index in the array-list collection of the first polynomial
        position_2 - index in the array-list collection in the second polynomial
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • multiplication

        public Polynomial multiplication(int position_1,
                                 int position_2)
        calculates and returns the product of two polynomials from the array-list collecion. polynomials can be added with them self
        Parameters:
        position_1 - index in the array-list collection of the first polynomial
        position_2 - index in the array-list collection in the second polynomial
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • multi_fractions

        private Polynomial multi_fractions(double multiplicator,
                                   int power,
                                   int position_2)
        sub-method of multiplication. the calculation looks like:
        multiplicator * x ^ power * (polynomial[= collection.get(position_2)])
        Parameters:
        multiplicator - the factor in front of "x"
        power - the power of "x"
        position_2 - the intex of the polyinomial which gets multiplicated
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • multi_addition

        private Polynomial multi_addition(Polynomial polynomial_1,
                                  Polynomial polynomial_2)
        sub-method of multiplication. equals the methodaddition, but with not stored but handed over polynomials
        Parameters:
        polynomial_1 - polynomial 1
        polynomial_2 - polynomial 2
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • divisionHorner

        public Polynomial divisionHorner(int position,
                                 java.lang.String a_value)
        calculates a division using the horner-scheme and returns the result as an polynomial of the class Polynomial
        Parameters:
        position - index
        a_value - a-value of the term (x-a) Is the a_value not parsable to Double the result is given as the y for = 0.
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • root

        public double root(int position)
        finds and returns a root of a polynomial from the array-list collection
        the algorithm uses iteration over the area -10`000 - 10`000
        with valueAt_Horner a root is approximated
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial in the array-list collection
        Returns:
        Polynomial

      • derivative

        public Polynomial derivative(int position,
                             java.lang.String value)
        calculates and returns a derivative from a polynomial from the array-list collection
        Parameters:
        position - index of the polynomial in the array-list collection
        value - grade of the derivative
        Returns:
        Polynomial
